channel.title: Help with PHP - Regex
channel.description:
Im new to regex and i was wondering if anyone knew what was wrong with this :confused:
[code] a href="\^[a-zA-Z]{3,}[0-9]{1,}$.\runescape.\com [/code]
At the regex tester at http://www.regexlib.com/RETester.aspx it cant find anything and i dont know whats wrong :cool:
Its to get the prefix of all the the runescape worlds from the world select

item.title: Help with PHP - Regex
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

explode the top off first using an explode

then just run the search on the 2nd part of the array[br][size=1]Posted at: June 26, 2006, 08:14:48 pm[/size][hr]explode using this

“” without quotes thatll make the 2nd part of the array only the body html, no javascript or css

Read full topic

item.title: Help with PHP - Regex
item.dc:creator: @danrox2004 danrox2004
item.description:
@danrox2004 wrote:

oh ok thanks!

Ok i edited it a bit so it was a bit more specific:

[a-z]{2,6}[0-9]{1,2}

item.title: Help with PHP - Regex
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

to get only the prefix you would then have to get rid of the a href=" bit and the rest of .runescape"

Read full topic

item.title: Help with PHP - Regex
item.dc:creator: @danrox2004 danrox2004
item.description:
@danrox2004 wrote:

ok thanks frank rep++ if it works =)
so if i only wanted the prefix i would do

"a href="^[a-zA-Z0-9]+$\.runescape\.com"

and the problem was

a href=[b]"\[/b]^[a-zA-Z]{3,}[0-9]{1,}$[b].\[/b]runescape[b].\[/b]com

i did the backslash on the wrong side of the thingys

Read full topic

item.title: Help with PHP - Regex
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

“a href=”[a-zA-Z0-9]+.runescape.com"

SHOULD (if i got it right) return something like "a href=“au3.runescape.com”

Read full topic
